info.title: Keycloak Admin REST API
info.description: This is a REST API reference for the Keycloak Admin REST API.

get.description: Get accessible realms Returns a list of accessible realms. The list is filtered based on what realms the caller is allowed to view.

post.description: Import a realm. Imports a realm from a full representation of that realm.

get.description: Get the top-level representation of the realm It will not include nested information like User and Client representations.

put.description: Update the top-level information of the realm Any user, roles or client information in the representation will be ignored.

get.description: Get admin events Returns all admin events, or filters events based on URL query parameters listed here

delete.description: Clear any user login failures for all users This can release temporary disabled users

get.description: Get status of a username in brute force detection

delete.description: Clear any user login failures for the user This can release temporary disabled user

get.description: Get authenticator providers Returns a stream of authenticator providers.
Get client authenticator providers Returns a stream of client authenticator providers.

post.description: Create new authenticator configuration

get.description: Get authenticator provider’s configuration description
Get authenticator configuration

put.description: Update authenticator configuration

post.description: Add new authentication execution

get.description: Get Single Execution

post.description: Update execution with new configuration

get.description: Get execution’s configuration

post.description: Lower execution’s priority
Raise execution’s priority

get.description: Get authentication flows Returns a stream of authentication flows.

post.description: Create a new authentication flow
Copy existing authentication flow under a new name The new name is given as 'newName' attribute of the passed JSON object

parameters.name: flowAlias
parameters.description: name of the existing authentication flow

get.description: Get authentication executions for a flow

put.description: Update authentication executions of a Flow

post.description: Add new authentication execution to a flow
Add new flow with new execution to existing flow

get.description: Get authentication flow for id

put.description: Update an authentication flow

Get form providers Returns a stream of form providers.
Get configuration descriptions for all clients

post.description: Register a new required actions

Get required action for alias

put.description: Update required action

post.description: Lower required action’s priority
Raise required action’s priority

get.description: Get unregistered required actions Returns a stream of unregistered required actions.

post.description: Base path for importing clients under this realm.

get.description: Base path for retrieve providers with the configProperties properly filled
Get client scopes belonging to the realm Returns a list of client scopes belonging to the realm

post.description: Create a new client scope Client Scope’s name must be unique!

delete.description: Remove client-level roles from the client’s scope.

Get effective client roles Returns the roles for the client that are associated with the client’s scope.

parameters.description: if false, return roles with their attributes

Get effective realm-level roles associated with the client’s scope What this does is recurse any composite roles associated with the client’s scope and adds the roles to this lists.

parameters.description: if false, return roles with their attributes

post.description: Get a keystore file for the client, containing private key and public certificate
Generate a new certificate with new key pair

Generate a new keypair and certificate, and get the private key file  Generates a keypair and certificate and serves the private key in a specified keystore format. Only generated public certificate is saved in Keycloak DB - the private key is not.
Upload certificate and eventually private key
Upload only certificate, not private key

parameters.description: either realm name OR client UUID

parameters.name: roleContainerId
parameters.description: either realm name OR client UUID

get.description: Get users Returns a stream of users, filtered according to query parameters

parameters.name: briefRepresentation
parameters.description: Only return basic information (only guaranteed to return id, username, created, first and last name, email, enabled state, email verification state, federation link, and access. Note that it means that namely user attributes, required actions, and not before are not returned.)

post.description: Test SMTP connection with current logged in user

get.description: Get users Returns a stream of users, filtered according to query parameters.

parameters.name: briefRepresentation
parameters.description: Boolean which defines whether brief representations are returned (default: false)

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: A String contained in email, or the complete email, if param "exact" is true

parameters.name: emailVerified
parameters.description: whether the email has been verified

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Boolean representing if user is enabled or not

parameters.name: exact
parameters.description: Boolean which defines whether the params "last", "first", "email" and "username" must match exactly

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: A String contained in firstName, or the complete firstName, if param "exact" is true

parameters.name: idpAlias
parameters.description: The alias of an Identity Provider linked to the user

parameters.name: idpUserId
parameters.description: The userId at an Identity Provider linked to the user

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: A String contained in lastName, or the complete lastName, if param "exact" is true

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A query to search for custom attributes, in the format 'key1:value2 key2:value2'

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A String contained in username, first or last name, or email. Default search behavior is prefix-based (e.g., foo or foo*). Use foo for infix search and "foo" for exact search.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: A String contained in username, or the complete username, if param "exact" is true

post.description: Create a new user Username must be unique.

get.description: Returns the number of users that match the given criteria.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Boolean representing if user is enabled or not

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: arbitrary search string for all the fields below. Default search behavior is prefix-based (e.g., foo or foo*). Use foo for infix search and "foo" for exact search.

get.description: Get representation of the user

parameters.name: userProfileMetadata
parameters.description: Indicates if the user profile metadata should be added to the response

put.description: Update the user

get.description: Return credential types, which are provided by the user storage where user is stored.
Get consents granted by the user

delete.description: Revoke consent and offline tokens for particular client from user
Remove a credential for a user

post.description: Move a credential to a position behind another credential

parameters.name: newPreviousCredentialId
parameters.description: The credential that will be the previous element in the list. If set to null, the moved credential will be the first element in the list.

post.description: Move a credential to a first position in the credentials list of the user

put.description: Update a credential label for a user
Disable all credentials for a user of a specific type
Send an email to the user with a link they can click to execute particular actions.

parameters.name: lifespan
parameters.description: Number of seconds after which the generated token expires

get.description: Get social logins associated with the user

post.description: Add a social login provider to the user

delete.description: Remove a social login provider from user

post.description: Impersonate the user
Remove all user sessions associated with the user Also send notification to all clients that have an admin URL to invalidate the sessions for the particular user.

put.description: Set up a new password for the user.
Send an email to the user with a link they can click to reset their password.
